parameters: \pop[2]I ask for some private time with Isaac, and nobody seems to mind.
\pop[2]This might be our last chance for a heart-to-heart before \c[23]Hermes Day\c[0].
\pop[2]It must be pretty flattering to have a day named after yourself, huh...?
I'm kinda glad we won that bet.
\i[2]"Let's use the money to take a vacation together."
\i[5]"Same. Let's all go out for a nice dinner when this is over."
\i[0]"I feel bad taking money from Dante like that."
\i[2]"Let's use the money to take a vacation together."
I'm game. But where should we go...?
\i[5]"Same. Let's all go out for a nice dinner when this is over."
\pop[3]You know me, I'd just suggest the Triple R.
But I don't think that's as "nice" as you're requesting.
\i[0]"I feel bad taking money from Dante like that."
He's got more than enough to spare.
\pop[3]And he's working on another book, too.
That launch should \c[14]definitely\c[0] line his pockets.
\pop[2]He starts thinking, but then stops almost immediately.
I take it you wanted to talk about something specific?
\i[3]"I can't stop thinking about what you told me."
\i[3]"I can't stop thinking about what you told me."
\pop[3]You mean my true role in all of this?
Trust me, I'm still coming to terms with it myself.
\pop[2]He starts pacing around the room as he speaks.
\pop[3]You know it's all tied to my vision, right?
I'm pretty sure Dante made that \c[14]perfectly\c[0] clear.
\pop[3]Can you \c[14]imagine\c[0] having a weight like that on your shoulders?
Knowing that \c[14]you\c[0] need to be the one who changes the world?
\i[3]"I can't imagine that kind of pressure, no..."
\i[3]"I can't imagine that kind of pressure, no..."
In fact, I'd argue that we're not \c[14]meant\c[0] to.
\pop[3]But I've lived it, every day, for almost my entire life.
And I know that nothing but absolute \c[14]perfection\c[0] will ensure my success.
\pop[3]I don't think it's possible to re-create a vision one-to-one.
I think there's always gonna be differences, and changes.
\pop[3]But with how much is on the line? I can't afford \c[14]any\c[0] of that.
For about a decade, I've lived knowing that I have to achieve the impossible.
\pop[3]And if I don't pull it off? Then nothing changes.
\c[10]Argus\c[0] still has us in their pocket, and the \c[23]zeros\c[0] are still stuck outside.
\pop[3]Is it so much to ask for just a \c[14]little\c[0] harmony in the world?
\pop[2]I can't help but sympathize with him.
\pop[2]It must feel nice to open up about all of this, though.
\pop[2]Part of me feels like I'm the first person he's ever told.
\pop[3]I used to tell myself that a miracle would happen.
That one day, a switch would flick, and everything would make sense.
All the missing pieces would fall into place, and I'd be able to pull this off.
I've been winging it this entire time.
\pop[3]There's no such thing as a miracle.
Just... hope, and how we choose to wield it.
\pop[2]Right now, my hope is that these memories could come to our aid.
\pop[2]That no matter what happens, this period of my life will be a time capsule.
\pop[2]And one day, when it needs to be opened, people can see what \c[14]really\c[0] happened.
\pop[2]I flip the conversation around, and vocalize these thoughts to Isaac.
\pop[2]I know it's going to sound ridiculous. But honestly, so does the fact that he's \c[23]Hermes\c[0].
\i[3]"It's about that agent. I know I saw them."
\i[3]"It's about that agent. I know I saw them."
We could go over the footage together, if you wanted.
\i[3]"It wouldn't work. They're watching from afar."
\i[3]"It wouldn't work. They're watching from afar."
\pop[3]But you said they were right in front of you...
\i[3]"Far away, as in watching from the future."
\i[3]"Far away, as in watching from the future."
\i[3]"I think it has to do with the new \c[10]Nostalgia Technology\c[0]."
\i[3]"I think it has to do with the new \c[10]Nostalgia Technology\c[0]."
\i[3]"I think, in the future, they're investigating our lives."
\i[3]"I think, in the future, they're investigating our lives."
\i[3]"And I might be feeling some sort of weird aftereffect."
\i[3]"And I might be feeling some sort of weird aftereffect."
\pop[2]Isaac sighs, signaling disbelief, and even a hint of annoyance.
\pop[2]I expect his next words to chastise me, and tell me to get back to reality.
\i[3]"How? It barely makes sense to me."
\i[3]"How? It barely makes sense to me."
\pop[3]Well, maybe it doesn't make sense, per se.
It's just a... logical deduction, given everything that's happened.
I've been seeing things in the corner of \c[14]my\c[0] eye, too.
\pop[3]And I know all about the \c[10]Nostalgia Tech\c[0], as well.
It's been mentioned in a lot of internal e-mails.
It's not like they can do anything to us from there.
\i[3]"Maybe not. But we can do something to \c[14]them\c[0]".
\i[3]"Maybe not. But we can do something to \c[14]them\c[0]".
\i[3]"We live our lives knowing that they'll view our memories."
\i[3]"We live our lives knowing that they'll view our memories."
\i[3]"We can leave behind any message we want. Any \c[14]memories\c[0] we want."
\i[3]"We can leave behind any message we want. Any \c[14]memories\c[0] we want."
\pop[3]Wow. Fancy a game of 4D Chess, huh?
\pop[2]He starts to think. I'm left in an awkward silence for several moments.
\pop[3]The very flow of time would be our battlefield...
\i[3]"Make sure they know that we're good people."
\i[3]"Make sure they know that we're good people."
Good people can still do bad things.
\pop[3]In fact, there's nothing more harmful than good intentions.
We should send them a \c[14]real\c[0] message. Something substantial...
Remember, we're going \c[14]right\c[0] into their HQ.
If my sights could become evidence, I need to re-think my plan.
\pop[2]I'm shocked by how quickly he's accepting my theory.
\pop[2]It's almost too convenient, so I ask him, hoping I don't come off as paranoid.
\pop[3]Like I said, it makes perfect sense.
\pop[3]I live my life constantly experiencing memories of the future.
Say whatever you want, but that's \c[14]literally\c[0] impossible.
\pop[3]The idea that we'll be able to revisit past memories?
That's \c[14]nothing\c[0] compared to the reality \c[14]I\c[0] face.
\pop[3]Besides, it was only a matter of time, anyway.
\pop[3]This just feels like the next step, doesn't it?
\pop[3]Of course, it'll just be tainted by the hands of \c[10]Argus\c[0].
There's no \c[14]way\c[0] their motivations are selfless.
\pop[3]But selfish motivations can only be fought with selfless hands.
So I say we turn this around, and put them in their place.
\pop[2]I nod. That's basically what I had planned.
\pop[2]Of course, I really just wanted him to open up to me.
\pop[2]People in the future deserved to know who he \c[14]really\c[0] was.
\pop[2]Because if they didn't, then \c[10]Argus\c[0] would fill in the gaps.
\pop[2]And something told me they wouldn't see him as the hero that I do.
Sorry. Guess I got caught up in the bigger picture.
\pop[3]But that makes perfect sense to me.
You focus on capturing the group, and I'll do the rest.
I \c[14]know\c[0] I can use this future technology against them in the present.
\pop[2]He sits on the edge of the bed, and softly pats the spot beside him.
\pop[2]I join him, and we look at each other with a smile.
For the record, though. I want to open up to \c[14]you\c[0].
If someone else is watching, that doesn't change anything.
\pop[2]I nod. Otherwise, this would be an interrogation.
\pop[2]I can't force them to tell me their story. I can only ask them to open up willingly.
\pop[2]Thankfully, this group is bound by trust. A trust that now reveals all our true natures.
\pop[3]Well, what did I tell you last time?
\i[3]"And you were a master at tinkering with technology."
\i[3]"And you were a master at tinkering with technology."
\pop[3]Good to know you were paying attention~
\pop[2]He smirks. Was that some sort of test?
\pop[3]I guess I can pick up the story from that part.
You already know most of my secrets, anyway.
\pop[2]Rubbing the back of his head, he blushes softly.
\pop[3]But first and foremost, I have to thank you.
I was scared you'd run away when I told you the truth.
My role in \c[23]Cipher\c[0] hasn't made me the most... forthcoming.
\pop[3]It'd be so easy to call me a liar, and go off on your way.
In fact, I can tell that Dante and Taylor were considering it.
You learn a thing or two about reading people in retail.
\pop[2]It's true. He did tell quite a few lies.
\pop[2]But I can understand the need to keep his secret.
\pop[2]He had an exceptional burden weighing down his every move.
\pop[2]It must've felt good for him to finally let out these secrets.
But I can try to fill in the gaps.
\pop[2]He tugs at the collar of his leather jacket.
\pop[3]When I was growing up, I always liked messing with \c[10]Argus\c[0] tech.
I guess I wanted to mimic my dad, since I could tell he was successful.
\pop[3]Even though I was a kid, I actually \c[14]helped\c[0] him with his work.
That's probably when he started to realize the potential I had.
\pop[3]I remember fiddling with our security system.
You know, kind of like I do in \c[14]our\c[0] house.
\pop[3]My dad started to be concerned with his safety.
I don't know why, but he kept "testing" the security system.
In his paranoia, I guess he needed to know if it still worked.
\pop[3]But that test alarm always terrified me, especially as a kid.
So, like you might've guessed, I found a way to mute it.
\pop[2]He laughs, like even \c[14]he's\c[0] surprised at how talented he was.
It was there to keep us safe, after all.
But as kids, I don't think we fully understand danger, and paranoia.
\pop[3]So then, he got a \c[14]new\c[0] security system.
It was more advanced, and more attached to \c[10]The System\c[0].
Theoretically, it wouldn't be possible for me to mute this one.
\pop[3]But I'm not the type to back down from a challenge.
Sure enough, I cracked this one too. He was \c[14]furious\c[0].
Well, furious, with a side of shock and awe, of course.
\pop[2]True. That was an impressive feat for a child to pull off.
\pop[3]That's where I stopped the story last time, right?
This time, it was unreleased, experimental tech.
\pop[3]It worked, and passed all of his tests just fine.
I didn't want to get in trouble, so I left it alone.
One night, someone broke into our home.
\pop[3]And sure enough, the alarm didn't go off.
My dad told me to run, and hide under his bed.
I don't know who broke in, but they started fighting.
The look on my dad's face when he told me to run away.
He obviously knew that the security system was muted.
\pop[3]And in that moment, I could tell he blamed it on \c[14]me\c[0].
I couldn't defend myself, either. All I could do was hide.
\pop[3]So, yeah. His final thoughts of me will \c[14]always\c[0] be ones of anger...
But I was innocent. It was his trust in the tech that hurt him.
\pop[2]So his dad was \c[10]killed\c[0]...? I didn't expect to hear that.
I disobeyed him every chance I got, after all.
\pop[3]And the \c[14]one\c[0] time I start listening to him?
You know how cruel irony can be...
\pop[3]If I ignored his orders, I would've opened up the tech.
Then, I could've fixed what was wrong with it.
\pop[3]That's a lesson I've carried with me ever since.
In fact, I'm using that defiance to save the \c[23]zeros\c[0].
I can't just sit back and do nothing. Not like last time.
\pop[2]He's using his past to justify his current actions.
\pop[2]But it's not just his current actions.
\pop[2]I suddenly see him in a completely different light.
\pop[2]He sells and installs \c[10]Argus\c[0] tech, so he can make sure it's done \c[14]correctly\c[0].
\pop[2]Otherwise, someone else might lose a loved one to a faulty device, or glitch.
\pop[2]He follows in his father's footsteps, because he feels responsible for what happened.
\pop[2]I suppose if you rob someone of their legacy, you have to make it your own...
\pop[2]All of that stuff is so tragic. But then there's his vision...
\pop[2]Devoting his life to a corporation that he knew he'd end up defying...?
\pop[2]Besmirching the name of himself, \c[14]and\c[0] the legacy of his father...?
\pop[2]No. That'd only happen if we lose. I know Isaac is doing the right thing, here.
\c[10]Argus\c[0] tech is all I ever really knew.
After my dad died, I went to live with his brother.
\pop[3]But even then, I preferred working with technology.
I didn't really make friends, or bond with my uncle.
\pop[3]He was mad that I kept this leather jacket.
Said I needed to let go, instead of carrying the past with me.
But I know he was just projecting. It was a reminder of his brother.
\pop[3]But it's hard for me to let go of this thing, Delta.
It gave me safety during one of the worst moments in my life.
When I was under that bed, it was all I had to wrap around myself.
I laid under the bed for almost twenty-four hours.
I waited until the police arrived, like I was taught.
\pop[3]Those flashing \c[23]blue\c[0] and \c[17]yellow\c[0] lights lit up the bedroom.
\c[14]That's\c[0] when I knew it was safe to come out.
Of course, I came out to some bad news...
\pop[2]I place my hand on top of his, intertwining our fingers.
\pop[2]I nod at him. That was more than fine.
\pop[2]That was a lot to take in, but it made me understand him so much more.
\pop[2]And if he was going to be a man with a legacy, he'd want this to be a part of it.
Gotta commend you for the idea, Delta.
\pop[3]And if people ever listen in on this?
Well, I'm happy with the way I worded things.
\pop[3]It's important for the world to know what makes me tick, right?
Every detail we hold back will be a detail lost to time.
\pop[3]And I'd never want to lose what we have...
\pop[2]He places a hand on my cheek, and looks into my eyes.
\pop[3]All this talk about what shapes me, and makes me tick.
It'd be remiss of me not to give you the spotlight.
\pop[2]He smiles, and laughs; but it has a mischievous tone.
\pop[3]Our love transcends time, isn't that cool?
A real romance for the ages.
\pop[3]Who knows how many people might experience this?
That \c[10]Nostalgia Tech\c[0] could turn all of our lives into a stage.
\pop[3]So let's work toward a standing ovation...
\pop[2]We both lean forward, and our lips lock together.
\pop[2]I can fell all of his passion, but also all of his pain.
\pop[2]His grip on my hand tightens, and I feel him tremble.
\pop[2]A few moments later, the kiss is broken.
\pop[2]He looks at me, with glistening eyes, and a wide smile.
\pop[3]I'm just glad that our friendship will persevere, too.
I owe a lot of my success to you, Delta.
\pop[2]He smiles, and laughs; but it has a mischievous tone.
\pop[3]Our bond transcends time, isn't that cool?
A real friendship for the ages.
\pop[3]Who knows how many people might experience this?
That \c[10]Nostalgia Tech\c[0] could turn all of our lives into a stage.
\pop[3]Good thing we're on track for a standing ovation, huh?
\pop[2]He holds out a fist, and I bump mine against his.
\pop[2]Then, a moment later, he pulls me in for a tight hug.
